graph.topic: Giving mobile phones to the unemployed

nodes.text: I agree to this solution only to a certain degree
giving those with no work a mobile phone each is a total waste of money
when people without jobs have hand phones that have access to the Internet, they will be able to browse the net for more job opportunities
they can surf the The Star Onlines' work section to find a job that is suitable for them
With the help of the net, they can also do more research on the work that they have found apart from looking up on how they can prepare themselves for the job
the mobile phones can also be used to make calls with the companies in which they would like to work with
if the government provides those without work with a mobile phone, they will be able to find themselves an occupation in order to live and survive
supplying hand phones to the unemployed is a waste of the taxpayers' money
the money instead of being used to supply the electronic gadget can be used for other useful purposes for the country
the money can be used to build more amenities for the public or given to the poor
they can use it to help them earn a living
the money can be used for other intentions rather than giving hand phones to the unemployed
when hand phones are provided for free, many would want to take advantage of this opportunity
Some might even go to the extent of lying that they are on unemployment to make them eligible to get the phones
in order to obtain a mobile phone, they make themselves jobless
the public's money is spent worthlessly
there are no surveys or evidences that prove this method in effective in reducing the rate of unemployment
the suggestion of providing those who are jobless with mobile phones that are accessible to internet is not a proper and the best way to trim down the rate of unemployment
I suggest the government look into the background of the people in depth before giving out hand phones to them
the public money should be utilized for the benefit of the society and not just for some of them who are not willing to put in more effort to find them a proper work
